FuncDef:
The local-vni command binds an EVPL instance in VXLAN mode to a VNI.
The undo local-vni command unbinds an EVPL instance in VXLAN mode from a VNI.
By default, an EVPL instance in VXLAN mode is not bound to any VNI.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the ID of a VNI to be bound to an EVPL instance.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 16777215.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To bind a P2P VXLAN tunnel to an EVPL instance, run the local-vni command to bind the EVPL instance in VXLAN mode to the VNI of the P2P VXLAN tunnel.
Precautions
An EVPL instance can be bound to one VNI. Likewise, a VNI can be bound to one EVPL instance.The binding relationship between an EVPL instance and a VNI cannot be modified. However, you can run the undo local-vni command to delete the binding relationship and then run the local-vni command to re-create a binding relationship.When an EVPL instance is deleted, its binding relationship with a VNI is also deleted.
